top_categories.workout_context: Santa Fe Century Gravelón rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Santa Fe Century Gravelón when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Santa Fe Century Gravelón. Make this intensity feel like home.
Santa Fe Century Gravelón’s new mexico mountains, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 100 miles, Santa Fe Century Gravelón punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Santa Fe Century Gravelón’s 7,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Racing Santa Fe Century Gravelón isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Santa Fe Century Gravelón intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Santa Fe Century Gravelón’s new mexico mountains gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Santa Fe Century Gravelón’s 7,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Santa Fe Century Gravelón — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
At 100 miles, Santa Fe Century Gravelón rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Santa Fe Century Gravelón’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Santa Fe Century Gravelón. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Santa Fe Century Gravelón requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on new mexico mountains gravel to build confidence. Expect: new mexico mountains, mountain gravel, high altitude.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and G Spot to prepare you for 100 miles of new mexico mountains gravel in Santa Fe, NM.
